fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G1b" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:sliceName [ fhir:v "item-G1b" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "G1b. 疼痛的頻率為：" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "BackboneElement"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "qrs-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "(answer.exists() and item.exists()).not()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "not(exists(f:answer) and exists(f:item))" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:mustSupport [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v ".outboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN]" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G1b.id" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.id" ] ;
      ( fhir:representation [ fhir:v "xmlAttr" ] ) ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Unique id for inter-element referencing" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.id" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
        ( fhir:extension [
fhir:url [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/structuredefinition-fhir-type"^^xsd:anyURI ] ;
fhir:value [ fhir:v "string"^^xsd:anyURI ]         ] ) ;
fhir:code [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhirpath/System.String"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G1b.extension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.extension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.extension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G1b.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "BackboneElement.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). fhir:short [ fhir:v "疼痛的頻率。[應填入以下字串之一：一個月數次 | 一週數次 | 每天疼痛 | 不知道或無法判斷]" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question." ] ;

fhir:binding [
        ( fhir:extension [

fhir:map [ fhir:v ".item" ]       ] )     ] [

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Nested groups and questions" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "It is useful to have \"sub-questions\", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details." ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "G2a. 請問個案現在的皮膚狀況？" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;

      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2a.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "BackboneElement.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2b.definition" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.definition" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "ElementDefinition - details for the item" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.definition" ] ;

      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;

fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.       ( fhir:mapping [

fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2b.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "BackboneElement.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifierReason [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them" ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

fhir:map [ fhir:v "N/A" ]       ] )     ] [

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;

fhir:map [ fhir:v ".outboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN]" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:sliceName [ fhir:v "item-G2d" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "G2d. 傷口情形" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "BackboneElement"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "qrs-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "(answer.exists() and item.exists()).not()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "not(exists(f:answer) and exists(f:item))" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:mustSupport [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v ".outboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN]" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.id" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.id" ] ;
      ( fhir:representation [ fhir:v "xmlAttr" ] ) ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Unique id for inter-element referencing" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.id" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
        ( fhir:extension [
fhir:url [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/structuredefinition-fhir-type"^^xsd:anyURI ] ;
fhir:value [ fhir:v "string"^^xsd:anyURI ]         ] ) ;
fhir:code [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhirpath/System.String"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.extension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.extension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;

fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;

fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.definition" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.definition" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "ElementDefinition - details for the item" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifierReason [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them" ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "N/A" ]       ] )     ] [

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.value[x]" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "傷口情形。[應填入以下字串之一：擦傷、割傷 | 壓傷 | 燒燙傷 | 術後傷口 | 延遲癒合之手術傷口 | 糖尿病足潰瘍 | 血管性潰瘍（動脈或靜脈；含足部以外的糖尿病潰瘍） | 其他]" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question." ] ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.       ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;

fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;

fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d1.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.id" ] ;
      ( fhir:representation [ fhir:v "xmlAttr" ] ) ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Unique id for inter-element referencing" ] ;

fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;

      ( fhir:type [
        ( fhir:extension [

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.extension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;

      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;

fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [

fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;

fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [

fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d1.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.       ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.extension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3a.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "BackboneElement.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). fhir:definition [ fhir:v "The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire." ] ;

        ( fhir:extension [

fhir:value [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireAnswer" ]         ] ) ;
fhir:strength [ fhir:v "example" ] ;
fhir:description [ fhir:v "Code indicating the response provided for a question." ] ;
fhir:valueSet [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers"^^xsd:anyURI ;

      ( fhir:mapping [

fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3a.answer.item" ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Nested groups and questions" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "It is useful to have \"sub-questions\", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.item" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
fhir:contentReference [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item"^^xsd:anyURI ] ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [

fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3a.item" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.item" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Reports can consist of complex nested groups." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.item" ] ;

      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;

fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:sliceName [ fhir:v "item-G3b" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "G3b. 受限制的位置" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "BackboneElement"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;

      ( fhir:representation [ fhir:v "xmlAttr" ] ) ;

      ( fhir:type [
        ( fhir:extension [

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;

      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;

fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "BackboneElement.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifierReason [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them" ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "受限制的位置。[應填入以下字串之一：肩關節 | 肘關節 | 腕指關節 | 髖關節 | 膝關節 | 踝關節 | 頸關節 | 全身關節]" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question." ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.definition" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "ElementDefinition - details for the item" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

      ( fhir:type [

fhir:pattern [ fhir:v "個案過去 3 個月體重是否減輕？" ] ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:mustSupport [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

fhir:map [ fhir:v ".text" ]       ] )     ] [

fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.       ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;

fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;

      ( fhir:mapping [

fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4a.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;

fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifierReason [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them" ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;

fhir:map [ fhir:v "N/A" ]       ] )     ] [

fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.answer.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;

fhir:sliceName [ fhir:v "item-G4c" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "G4c. 個案一般的飲食狀況，以週為單位" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer)." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "1"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item" ] ;

      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "BackboneElement"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "qrs-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "(answer.exists() and item.exists()).not()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "not(exists(f:answer) and exists(f:item))" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:mustSupport [ fhir:v "true"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v ".outboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN]" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.id" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.id" ] ;
      ( fhir:representation [ fhir:v "xmlAttr" ] ) ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Unique id for inter-element referencing" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces." ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ] ;
fhir:base [
fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.id" ] ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "1" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
        ( fhir:extension [
fhir:url [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/structuredefinition-fhir-type"^^xsd:anyURI ] ;
fhir:value [ fhir:v "string"^^xsd:anyURI ]         ] ) ;
fhir:code [ fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhirpath/System.String"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;

fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.extension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.extension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Additional content defined by implementations" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] ) ;
fhir:min [ fhir:v "0"^^xsd:nonNegativeInteger ] ;
fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ] ;

fhir:path [ fhir:v "Element.extension" ] ;

fhir:max [ fhir:v "*" ]       ] ;
      ( fhir:type [
fhir:code [ fhir:v "Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ]       ] ) ;
      ( fhir:constraint [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ele-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "All FHIR elements must have a @value or children" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "@value|f:*|h:div" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Element>         ]       ] [
fhir:key [ fhir:v "ext-1" ] ;
fhir:severity [ fhir:v "error" ] ;
fhir:human [ fhir:v "Must have either extensions or value[x], not both" ] ;
fhir:expression [ fhir:v "extension.exists() != value.exists()" ] ;
fhir:xpath [ fhir:v "exists(f:extension)!=exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), \"value\")])" ] ;
fhir:source [
fhir:v "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension"^^xsd:anyURI ;
fhir:link <http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Extension>         ]       ] ) ;
fhir:isModifier [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
fhir:isSummary [ fhir:v "false"^^xsd:boolean ] ;
      ( fhir:mapping [
fhir:identity [ fhir:v "rim" ] ;
fhir:map [ fhir:v "n/a" ]       ] )     ] [
fhir:id [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:path [ fhir:v "QuestionnaireResponse.item.modifierExtension" ] ;
fhir:short [ fhir:v "Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.\n\nModifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself)." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension)." ] ;
      ( fhir:alias [ fhir:v "extensions" ] [ fhir:v "user content" ] [ fhir:v "modifiers" ] ) ;

fhir:definition [ fhir:v "A reference to an [ElementDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "The ElementDefinition must be in a [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#), and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].\n\nThere is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed." ] ;
fhir:requirements [ fhir:v "A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition." ] ;

fhir:short [ fhir:v "個案一般的飲食狀況，以週為單位。[應填入以下字串之一：未吃完，每餐進食量不超過整餐的 1/3，或除正餐外沒有補充任何點心，或被禁食（或採清流質或靜脈輸液超過 5 天），或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 1600c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 800 大卡/日 | 未吃完，每餐進食量不超過整餐的 1/2，或偶爾吃點心，或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 2000c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 1000 大卡/日 | 未吃完，每餐進食量超過整餐的 1/2，或有時拒絕用餐但會吃點心，或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 2400c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 1200 大卡/日 | 每餐吃完，從不拒絕用餐，或不需任何補充食物，或灌食自製管灌飲食大於 2400c.c./日，或採用管灌飲食（或靜脈營養）大於 1200 大卡/日]" ] ;
fhir:definition [ fhir:v "The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question." ] ;
fhir:comment [ fhir:v "More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.
